original_title: India On The Trail Of The Tiger 3D
overview: India. No other country presents so many contrasts. Ethnical, religious and economic. The challenges of today however, are economic growth at any price – rapid population growth – and ecological balance. The list of endangered species at home in India is long.  The Indian government has been attempting to curb the extinction of species in the world’s third-largest country since 1973. Nature reserves have been established and reintroduction stations founded. Around 1.3 billion people in India need food - towns like Mumbai and Calcutta are bursting at the seams. But resources and arable land are limited – and the population is growing rapidly.  We want to find out here, in Kanha in the province of Madhya Pradesh - India’s geographical centre, how the balancing act between ecology and sustainability works out.  Join us in mystical India . See the greatest free-living big cats in fascinating 3D!
title: India On The Trail Of The Tiger 3D
